description: This course provides a foundation in language education methods for K-12 ESL and K-12 World
Language licensure. It is designed to provide the necessary knowledge base for students
preparing to teach ESL and/or world languages in the schools. This base includes both
theoretical background and practical strategies for planning and carrying out an effective
language education program in ESL or World Languages. Required 20-hour field experience
component. Offered annually in the spring semester. Also counts toward linguistic studies
fullname: Methods in EAL and World Language Instruction
